meanings.definition: The state or condition of being compelled or forced to do something.
meanings.sent1: Her compulsivity to check the door multiple times before leaving made her late for work.
meanings.sent2: His compulsivity to organize his desk every morning helped him stay focused throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The compulsivity of the cat to chase after the laser pointer provided endless entertainment for the family.
meanings.sent4: The compulsivity of the waves crashing against the shore was both mesmerizing and calming.
meanings.sent5: The compulsivity of the toddler to press all the buttons in the elevator made everyone smile.

meanings.definition: The quality of being difficult to control or resist.
meanings.sent1: The compulsivity of his sweet tooth often led him to indulge in sugary treats.
meanings.sent2: Her compulsivity for perfectionism sometimes caused her unnecessary stress.
meanings.sent3: The compulsivity of the squirrel to hoard acorns in the garden amused the neighbors.
meanings.sent4: The compulsivity of the vines creeping up the wall symbolized nature's unstoppable growth.
meanings.sent5: The compulsivity of the clock ticking away the seconds made the room feel eerily silent.
